answers.answer: First be sure that the problem is a cataract and that its bad enough to have surgery. Merely having a cataract does not require surgery until the vision is a big problem to him. Consider getting a second opinion.Causes of cataract at young age:  heavy use of alcohol, tobacco,  drugs such as steroids, trauma, diabetes, some metabolic and hereditary dieases, hereditary in family and bad luck.JCH IIIMD

question: My son aged 41 has just been diagnosed with one cataract which requires surgery. Is this unusual at this age ? It wasn't obvious at his eye exam a year ago. I am in my seventies and recently had cataract surgery which was only diagnosed as 'beginning' four years ago. The other eye vision seems to be correctable .
title: Cataract at 41
